Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior is partially covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior, which is slightly ribbed, is covered with a brown slip and remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394641) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394641)
